query: Analyze ROAS drop in last 30 days

insights.title: ROAS declined by 22.5% over 30 days
insights.description: Return on Ad Spend declined significantly from a 30-day baseline of 3.45 to current 7-day average of 2.67, representing a critical performance drop that directly impacts overall campaign ROI and efficiency.
insights.validation_notes: Strong quantitative evidence with large effect size (22.5% > 20%). Multiple supporting metrics. Critical direct business impact on ROI. Highly validated insight.

insights.title: Click-Through Rate declined by 18.5%
insights.description: Click-Through Rate dropped from 2.1% to 1.71%, a significant decline suggesting creative underperformance or audience fatigue from extended exposure to same ad variants.
supporting_metrics: Frequency increased 35% while impressions only up 12%
Decline concentrated in existing customer segments
New audience segments showing stable CTR
insights.validation_notes: Clear pattern with strong supporting evidence. Creative fatigue hypothesis well-supported by frequency vs. impression gap. Valid with actionable recommendations.

insights.title: Cost Per Click increased by 8%
insights.description: CPC increased from $0.93 to $1.01, indicating rising click acquisition costs likely due to audience saturation and declining ad relevance scores.
supporting_metrics: Quality score declining on high-frequency audiences
insights.validation_notes: Secondary metric supporting primary ROAS decline. Moderate effect size. Clear efficiency deterioration pattern.

hypotheses.statement: Creative fatigue is causing CTR and ROAS decline
hypotheses.description: Extended exposure to the same creative variants is reducing engagement and conversion rates as audience fatigue sets in, causing the observed CTR drop and contributing to ROAS decline.
hypotheses.reasoning: CTR down 18.5% while frequency up 35% is the classic creative fatigue pattern. Frequency increase without proportional impression growth indicates audience saturation and repeated exposure effects.
supporting_evidence: CTR declined 18.5% while frequency increased 35% (classic fatigue indicator)
Same creative variants served for 60+ days without rotation
Decline concentrated in high-frequency audience segments
Engagement metrics declining on specific audiences
New audience segments showing stable CTR (2.1%), proving creatives still work with fresh audiences
hypotheses.recommended_test: Rotate new creative variants and measure CTR/ROAS impact

hypotheses.statement: Audience saturation is reducing ad effectiveness
hypotheses.description: The available audience for this campaign may be approaching saturation, reducing reach quality and conversion probability as the platform shows ads to increasingly lower-intent users.
hypotheses.reasoning: Increases in frequency (35%) significantly exceed impression increases (12%), suggesting the platform is running out of fresh users and recycling to existing audience.
supporting_evidence: Frequency increase (35%) exceeds impression increase (12%) - core saturation signal
CPM increasing despite volume stability (platform cost rising = quality declining)
Declining conversion rates specifically on high-frequency users
Geographic segments saturating faster than others
hypotheses.recommended_test: Expand audience segments (lookalike, interest-based) or refresh targeting parameters

correlations.interpretation: Strong negative correlation: higher ad frequency associates with lower CTR (classic creative fatigue effect). For every 10% increase in frequency, CTR declines ~1.5%.
correlations.actionability: HIGH - Clear signal that creative rotation is needed

correlations.interpretation: Older creative variants correlate with lower CTR. Each additional 30 days of creative serving associates with ~2% CTR decline.
Higher CPM correlates with lower quality scores, indicating platform is charging more for lower-relevance placements.

summary.key_finding: ROAS decline (22.5%) primarily driven by creative fatigue, evidenced by CTR drop (18.5%) combined with frequency increase (35%), concentrated in existing customer segments
summary.root_cause: Creative fatigue from 60+ days of same creative variants

recommended_next_steps: Launch TEST_001: Creative refresh (new designs angle) vs. existing top performer (7-day test, 50/50 budget split)
Launch TEST_002: Video format vs. static creative (14-day test)
Monitor CTR and ROAS daily during tests
Scale winning creative to 60%+ of budget
Implement creative rotation cadence (new variants every 14 days)
